sec.p: 2,2′-diphenypicrylhydrazyl (DPPH) and β-carotene-linoleic acid assays were used following Elansary et al. ( 2017) to determine essential oils free radical scavenging activity of each sample which was expressed as IC 50 (μg mL −1) or the sample concentration required to scavenge 50% of DPPH/β-carotene-linoleic acid. Total and free ascorbate (non-enzymatic antioxidants) were quantified in ground frozen leaves following Elansary et al. ( 2017).

The enzymes activities of ascorbate peroxidase (APX), catalase (CAT), and superoxide dismutase (SOD) were quantified in leaves tissues according to Zhang and Kirkham ( 1996) and Elansary et al. ( 2017). ROS accumulation was determined by quantifying H 2O 2 composition in leaves following Elansary et al. ( 2017) and using the Beyotime Colorimetric Assay Kit (Beyotime, China).
